info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:32AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 900 AM EDT... At 831 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Springboro, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Miamisburg, Springboro, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, Carlisle, West Carrollton, Waynesville, Harveysburg, Spring Valley, Corwin, Centerville, Oregonia, Lytle, Mount Holly, Roxanna, Pekin, State Route 48 at State Route 73, Caesar Creek State Park and Woodbourne-Hyde Park. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 36 and 38. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 37 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
